page.title: 04POLITICS FLADBURY PARISH.
page.content: Fladbury Parish Council first met on 15th December,1894:previously there had been what was called a Vestry Meeting in the church. The Council continued to meet,with many different members and the chairman,until 1974 when all Local Government was re-organised. The present council has nine members and a clerk.It meets eight times a year to discuss any matters affecting the parish.One of the meetings (May) ia for the elections to question the members. The council,which is elected every four years by secret ballot, has the same powers as Evesham or Pershore Town Councils. It is responsible, among other things, for street lighting,grass cutting, and the recreational facilities.
